title: GuardCondition
description: Boolean predicate evaluated by a NavigationGuard to determine whether route access should be permitted. Expressions may reference user session state, roles, or feature flags. Async conditions (e.g., token validation API calls) are supported with a configurable timeout; on timeout, the condition fails closed (access denied) to preserve security.

expression.description: Boolean predicate expression to evaluate â€” may be a JavaScript expression, CEL expression, or logical reference to a named predicate (e.g., 'user.isAuthenticated && user.roles.includes(route.meta.roles)').

async.description: When true, the expression is evaluated asynchronously (e.g., via an API call). The guard will await resolution up to the timeout limit before failing closed.

timeout.description: Maximum milliseconds to wait for an async condition to resolve. On timeout, the guard treats the condition as false (access denied) to fail securely.
